description: Through visits to the area around Cape Town and Johannesburg/Pretoria, this course examines
cultural diversity in South Africa and the important role religion has played in shaping and
sustaining the identity of various ethnic and racial groups. Students study the way religious
ideas were used to defend the apartheid system and also to justify protest against it. They
analyze organizations, post-apartheid, to build a multi-racial democracy and a just social order.
fullname: Religion and Cultural Diversity in South Africa (Abroad)
